classSpec.desc: provides attributes for specifying the beginning and end of a linguistic or textual segment, by addressing the character offsets or by identifying the edge elements via their ID.

sch:rule.sch:assert: when @referringMode is 'pointer' @from must be a URI
when @referringMode is 'pointer' @to must be a URI
when @referringMode is '' @from must be a counting number
when @referringMode is '' @to must be a counting number
when @referringMode is 'second' @from must be an integer
when @referringMode is 'second' @to must be an integer

attDef.desc: specifies whether the span/segment edges are identified as numeric offsets or as references to ID (URI).

valItem.desc: edges are identified by pointing at elements (e.g. w, c or seg) that can be pointed at by means of an URI (which most often means that they have xml:id attributes defined).
edges are identified by numeric offsets (non-negative integers)

edges are identified by numeric offsets (non-negative integers) identifying inter-character points. In e.g. the string "point", inter-character points are marked by vertical lines: |p|o|i|n|t| (by convention, there is an icp before the first character and after the last one).
edges are identified by numeric offsets (non-negative integers) addressing bytes.
edges are identified by offsets expressed as values that conform to the international standard Data elements and interchange formats – Information interchange – Representation of dates and times.
edges are identified by offsets expressed as values that conform to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition specification.

attDef.desc: specifies the starting point of the range of character offsets or elements that can be pointed at with an URI.
specifies the end-point of the range of character offsets or elements that can be pointed at with an URI.
